meanings.definition: Treat (a person or animal) with a vaccine to produce immunity against a disease.
meanings.sent1: The doctor is inoculating the child to protect them from getting sick.
meanings.sent2: The nurse will be inoculating the patients with flu shots today.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power was like inoculating shields against all illnesses.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude was like inoculating hope into the hearts of everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: Inoculating against diseases is like giving the body a shield to fight off invaders.

meanings.definition: Introduce (a microorganism or antigen) into a culture medium.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are inoculating the bacteria into the petri dish for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician will be inoculating the virus sample into the culture medium.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student joked about inoculating the classroom with invisible germs.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to inoculate doubt into the minds of his listeners.
meanings.sent5: Inoculating microorganisms into a culture medium is like planting seeds in soil.

meanings.definition: Introduce (cells or organisms) into a culture medium.
meanings.sent1: The biologist is inoculating the cells into the nutrient-rich solution.
meanings.sent2: In the lab, they will be inoculating the genetically modified organisms into the culture medium.
meanings.sent3: The prankster thought about inoculating the lab mice into the wrong cage as a joke.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to inoculate happiness into the hearts of those around her.
meanings.sent5: Inoculating cells into a culture medium is like placing them in a nurturing environment to grow.
